verses.verse: Yahweh,<WH3068> you have searched<WH2713> me,<WH3045> and you know me.
You know<WH3045> my sitting<WH3427> down and my rising<WH6965> up.<WH995> You perceive my thoughts<WH7454> from afar.<WH7350>
You search<WH2219> out my path<WH734> and my lying down,<WH7252> and are acquainted<WH5532> with all my ways.<WH1870>
For there is not a word<WH4405> on my tongue,<WH3956> but,<WH3068> behold, Yahweh, you know it altogether.<WH3045>
You hem<WH6696> me in behind<WH268> and before.<WH6924> You laid<WH7896> your hand on me.<WH3709>
This knowledge<WH1847> is beyond<WH6383> me.<WH7682> It's lofty. I can't<WH3201> attain it.
Where could I go<WH3212> from your Spirit?<WH7307> Or where could I flee<WH1272> from your presence?<WH6440>
If I ascend up<WH5266> into heaven,<WH8064> you are there.<WH3331> If I make my bed in Sheol,<WH7585> behold, you are there!
If I take<WH5375> the wings<WH3671> of the dawn,<WH7837> and settle<WH7931> in the uttermost parts<WH319> of the sea;<WH3220>
Even there your hand<WH3027> will lead<WH5148> me,<WH3225> and your right hand will hold me.<WH270>
If I say,<WH559> "Surely the darkness<WH2822> will overwhelm<WH7779> me;<WH216> the light around me<WH1157> will be night;<WH3915>"
even the darkness<WH2822> doesn't<WH2821> hide from you,<WH3915> but the night shines<WH215> as the day.<WH3117> The darkness<WH2825> is like light to you.<WH219>
For you formed<WH7069> my inmost<WH3629> being.<WH5526> You knit me together in my mother<WH517>'s womb.<WH990>
I will give thanks<WH3034> to you,<WH3372> for I am fearfully and wonderfully made.<WH6395> Your works<WH4639> are wonderful.<WH6381> My soul<WH5315> knows<WH3045> that very well.<WH3966>
My frame<WH6108> wasn't<WH3582> hidden from you,<WH6213> when I was made in secret,<WH5643> woven<WH7551> together in the depths<WH8482> of the earth.<WH776>
Your eyes<WH5869> saw<WH7200> my body.<WH1564> In your book<WH5612> they were all written,<WH3789> the days<WH3117> that were ordained<WH3335> for me,<WH259> when as yet there were none of them.
How precious<WH3365> to me are your thoughts,<WH7454> God!<WH410> How vast<WH6105> is their sum!<WH7218>
If I would count<WH5608> them,<WH7235> they are more in number than the sand.<WH2344> When I wake<WH6974> up,<WH5750> I am still with you.
If only you,<WH433> God, would kill<WH6991> the wicked.<WH7563> Get away<WH5493> from me,<WH1818> you bloodthirsty men!<WH582>
For they speak<WH559> against you wickedly.<WH4209> Your enemies<WH6145> take<WH5375> your name in vain.<WH7723>
Yahweh,<WH3068> don't<WH8130> I hate those who hate<WH8130> you?<WH6962> Am I not grieved with those who rise up against you?<WH8618>
I hate<WH8130> them with perfect<WH8503> hatred.<WH8135> They have become my enemies.<WH341>
Search<WH2713> me,<WH410> God, and know<WH3045> my heart.<WH3824> Try<WH974> me,<WH3045> and know my thoughts.<WH8312>
See<WH7200> if there is any wicked<WH6090> way<WH1870> in me,<WH5148> and lead me in the everlasting<WH5769> way.<WH1870>
